metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13098 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
BouncyCastle TLS prior to version 1.0.3, when configured to use the JCE(Java Cryptography Extension) for cryptographic functions, provides a weakBleichenbacher oracle when any TLS cipher suite using RSA key exchange isnegotiated. An attacker can recover the private key from a vulnerableapplication. This vulnerability is referred to as "ROBOT."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbcmail-java - 1.59-1
libbcpg-java - 1.59-1
libbcpkix-java - 1.59-1
libbcprov-java - 1.59-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bouncycastle package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.59-1').
